en: You ruined the wedding, J-Man. Of course you did—you were always going to, weren’t you?
zh: 你毀了婚禮，傑瑞，你把婚禮給毀了，不過你一直在計劃這樣做，不是嗎？

en: It was a self-fulfilling prophecy, the wedding ruined for no other reason than because everybody, including yourself, believed you were going to ruin it.
zh: 你這是自證預言，婚禮被毀了，沒有別的原因，只是因為包括你自己在內的所有人都認定你要毀掉婚禮。

en: Really, what you should be doing is making an I can believe it list, and put this one on the top.
zh: 真的，你應該做的是擬定「堅信不疑的清單」，並把這一條置頂。

en: The Wedding of Mass Destruction. The day your family went from a mixture of pitying you / being slightly put out by you / being somewhat amused by you, to straight out hating you.
zh: 這一天，你的家人歷經了多種情感的混合：他們憐憫你、擔憂你、被你逗樂，再到最終他們坦言恨你。

en: Hate is a strong word, but not strong enough.
zh: 「恨」是一個情感強烈的詞語，但還不夠強烈。

en: Thank God Sandra doesn’t know about the gun, otherwise right now you’d be bleeding from a dozen holes.
zh: 感謝老天，桑德拉並不知道槍的事情，否則現在你早就被打成馬蜂窩了。

en: At the moment you are hibernating in your office too scared to face her, and you’ve watched the footage from today over and over just like hundreds of other people have because Rick’s best man, let’s call him Prick, has posted it online.
zh: 此刻，你正在寫作房裡冬眠，你害怕面對她。你像其他幾百個人一樣，一遍又一遍地看今天的錄像，這都是因為瑞克的伴郎（讓我們叫他普瑞克）把它貼到了網上。

en: All the bloggers who hated you in the past now love you because you’ve given them one more reason to hate you.
zh: 所有以前恨你的博主現在都表示非常愛你，因為你給了他們更多恨你的理由。

en: The video was posted online less than an hour ago and has already had over a thousand hits.
zh: 視頻發布到網上還不到一小時，點擊量就已經過千。

en: The wedding itself went okay, but that’s because all the Stand here, Don’t stand here, Walk like this practicing got you through it.
zh: 婚禮本身進行得很順利，這都得益於「站在這裏，不要站在這裏，要這樣走」的練習，才幫你渡過這一關。

en: It’s a tough decision to put this into the journal for you, because in the future whatever little bit of your brain that hasn’t turned to soup is better off not knowing what happened.
zh: 用「急轉直下」這個詞還是有意地輕描淡寫，老兄，是否把此事寫進書里是個艱難的決定，因為等到將來你大腦還沒有亂成一鍋粥的時候，你還是別知道發生了什麼為好。

en: That’s what Alzheimer’s is, really—it’s a defense mechanism—it stops you from knowing how bad things are getting / have gotten.
zh: 這就是阿爾茨海默病，真的，它是一種防禦機制，讓你不知道事情會變得多糟，或已經糟糕到什麼地步了。

en: And for you, Jerry, things just got a whole lot worse.
zh: 至於你呢，傑瑞，你只會變得更糟。

en: But you know what?
zh: 但是，你知道嗎？

en: This journal is all about being honest. Best to write down all the details, and of course you can always go online and search Jerry Grey Wedding Speech if you want to see the moment it all happened, if you want to see your family watching in horror as what’s left of your dignity plummets.
zh: 日記是誠實的，最好能記下所有的細節，不過如果你想看到當時的那一刻，如果你想看到你的家人驚恐地看你有損尊嚴，你可以隨時上網，搜索「傑瑞·格雷的婚禮致辭」。

en: That’s what you need. There is some good news because the ceremony itself went off without a hitch, so let’s start there, huh?
zh: 好消息是婚禮儀式本身沒出什麼亂子，所以讓我們從這裏開始說起，好嗎？

en: Your wife disappeared in the morning to be with Eva and the bridesmaids to go ooh and ahh as they had their hair done, to relax the nerves with a glass of champagne, to have their makeup expertly applied, and to just generally enjoy the morning.
zh: 你妻子上午離開家去陪伊娃和伴娘，在她們做頭髮時表示讚歎，喝杯香檳放鬆放鬆，看著她們駕輕就熟地化妝，享受這個上午。

en: Hans came to look after you, and you sat out on the deck like always and you had a beer and since nobody else was around, he lit up a joint just like he used to.
zh: 漢斯過來看你，你們像往常一樣出去坐在露台上，你喝著啤酒，因為旁邊沒有其他人，他則像以往一樣點燃一支大麻。

en: The morning was hot. It’s not even summer yet, but if today is anything to go by, then the city is going to blister and burn.
zh: 雖然還沒到夏天，但上午就很熱了。

en: The wedding was scheduled for two o’clock.
zh: 婚禮定於下午兩點舉行。

en: Around twelve you put on the new suit and it looked sharp, really sharp, and you can count the times in your life on one hand that you’ve worn one.
zh: 大約中午十二點你穿上新禮服，顯得你斯文得體。你這一生穿過多少次禮服，一隻手也可以數得清。其實你很喜歡這種看上去成熟穩重的感覺。

en: You actually liked the feel of it, liked the way it made you look grown-up. All these years hanging out at home in a T-shirt and a pair of shorts always did make you feel like a kid.
zh: 這些年來，在家裡整天穿著一件短袖短褲始終讓你覺得自己像一個長不大的孩子。

en: You were just a crime writer, and do you remember that time you were detained flying back into New Zealand because you wrote Makeup on your immigration form as your occupation?
zh: 你只是一個犯罪小說家而已。你還記得那次飛回紐西蘭遭到扣留的事件嗎？因為你在移民表格里填寫了「編造」。

en: The woman at passport control didn’t find it funny and you were detained, but only for fifteen minutes during which you were given a stern telling off and a reminder that immigration was not a joke.
zh: 入境檢驗處的女工作人員認為這沒什麼好笑的，你就被扣留了，但只有十五分鐘，在這期間他們給予你嚴厲的警告。

en: But the fact of the matter is you are a makeup artist. Technically. Or were—because now you have a ghost makeup artist tapping those keys on your behalf.
zh: 移民不是笑話，但從技術層面來說，你就是一個擅長編造的藝術家啊。或者說，曾經是，因為你現在已經被一個擅長編造的幽靈藝術家鳩佔鵲巢了。

en: Hans drove you to the church and you got there thirty minutes early and things were still being set up.
zh: 漢斯開車送你去教堂，你們提前三十分鐘到達那裡，現場還在布置當中。

en: Belinda was there with her assistant carrying flowers out of the back of the van and loading them into the church, and you chatted for a minute with her before she had to disappear to the winery half an hour away to unload some more.
zh: 貝琳達和她的助手也在那裡，他們從廂式貨車上卸下鮮花，並把它們擺放在教堂中。你和她聊了一小會兒，她便起身去酒庄了，那裡距此有半小時的路程，而且還要卸下布置更多的花。

en: Guests started to arrive.
zh: 客人陸陸續續地來了。

en: They hung out in the parking lot in the sun. It was too nice a day to spend in the cool church. Some of them smoked, some laughed, chitchat filling the air.
zh: 陽光下，他們在停車場上閑逛、抽煙、歡笑、閑聊，在涼爽的教堂度過這美好的一天真是太美好了。

en: Rick and Prick and the groomsmen showed up in a black limousine, and it was pretty obvious they’d had a few drinks to calm their nerves, then a few more just for the fun of it.
zh: 瑞克和普瑞克乘坐著黑色豪華轎車來了，很明顯，他們都已經喝了幾杯讓自己鎮定下來，也有幾個人只是純粹為了好玩。

en: Rick had the same look in his eye hundred-meter sprinters have just before the firing gun goes off.
zh: 瑞克的神情就跟百米短跑運動員等待發令槍響時的神情一樣。

en: He came over and you introduced him to Hans, and Hans took his hand and applied a little too much pressure and said If you ever hurt her, if you ever cheat on her, Jerry here may not be around to protect his little girl, but I will be.
zh: 他走了過來，你把他介紹給漢斯，漢斯和他握手時故意用了點力，說：「如果你敢傷害她，如果你敢騙她，傑瑞可能不會過來保護他的女兒，但我會。

en: I would never hurt her, sir, Rick said.
zh: 「我永遠不會傷害她，先生。」瑞克說。

en: Then we don’t have a problem, do we?
zh: 「這樣我們就不存在問題了，不是嗎？」

en: No. There was no problem.
zh: 沒有，沒有問題。

en: The problem was still to come.
zh: 但問題還是來了。

en: More people were showing up, and Rick and his entourage went into the church and you stayed outside with Hans.
zh: 越來越多的人到了。瑞克一行走進教堂，你和漢斯則留在了外面。

en: There were family members you hadn’t seen in a while, mostly from Sandra’s side, her sister the gossip who has been married herself three times, a couple of cousins and an aunt and uncle you couldn’t remember from your side, a lot of Rick’s friends and family you’d never met, and a lot of Eva’s friends, some you’ve known since she was a kid.
zh: 有些親戚你有一段時間沒見了，大多是桑德拉的娘家人，她妹妹是個愛說長道短的八婆，結過三次婚。她還有兩個表兄弟，一個姑媽和一個叔叔，你都不記得他們了；還有瑞克的家人和朋友，你從來沒見過他們；還有伊娃的朋友，有些是她小時候你就認識的。

en: You shook a lot of hands, said How have you been a few dozen times, Nice to see you again a few dozen more, people who were strangers, people from your life you couldn’t remember, here was Jerry with his Alzheimer’s, Jerry to be pitied, Jerry who everybody was worried was going to mess up, and isn’t that just the setup to the world’s greatest punch line?
zh: 你和他們一一握手，說了幾十次「您好」，幾十次「很高興再次見到您」。其中有很多人你從來沒見過，還有很多人你記不起來了，站在這裏的是患有阿爾茨海默病的傑瑞，值得被同情的傑瑞，大家都擔心會把事情搞砸的傑瑞，這是不是天底下最好笑的笑話？這就是他們想要的嗎？

en: Isn’t that what they wanted? People go to car races hoping to see a good crash, don’t they?
zh: 人們去看賽車就是為了看車禍的好戲，不是嗎？

en: When the cars with the bridal party pulled up all murmurs coming from inside the church came to a stop.
zh: 當新娘一行乘坐的汽車出現時，教堂里瞬間鴉雀無聲。

en: You could hear the pews groaning as everybody shifted to look back towards the door.
zh: 在一片稀稀落落的長凳碰撞聲中，大家都轉身看向門口。

en: Eva climbed out of a dark blue fifty-year-old Jaguar, and she looked so much like Sandra on your wedding day that your heart froze and for a moment you were scared, actually scared you were having what Mrs. Smith would sum up as an episode.
zh: 伊娃從那輛深藍色五十年捷豹車上下來，她看起來那麼像你們婚禮當日的桑德拉，你愣住了，感到自己的心靜止不動。那一瞬間你很恐懼，害怕出現史密斯太太所說的「插曲」，但那不是插曲。

en: You had helped raise this amazing woman, and no matter what the future had in store, nobody could take that away from you.
zh: 你撫育了這位女孩，不管未來是怎麼安排的，沒有人可以把她從你身邊奪走。

en: You took her hand and hugged her, and told her she looked beautiful, and her smile widened and she hugged you back, and she was happy, she was filled with so much joy you actually felt like crying.
zh: 你牽著她的手，擁抱了她，告訴她她現在很美麗。她的笑容加深了，也擁抱了你。她很開心，臉上洋溢著喜悅，你有點兒想哭。

en: You hugged Sandra and her smile was almost as big as Eva’s, and she also looked like she was going to cry, and in that moment, Jerry, you forgave her for everything.
zh: 你擁抱了桑德拉，她臉上的笑容和伊娃一樣燦爛，她看上去也想要哭。那一刻，傑瑞，你原諒了她的一切。

en: Sandra had given you the best years of your life, and she still had a future ahead of her.
zh: 桑德拉把一生中最好的年華交付給你，但她仍然有她的未來。

en: Her body was warm and comforting and she smelled amazing, her hair smelled great, she felt fantastic against you, and in that moment you embraced your future.
zh: 她溫暖的身體讓他覺得很愜意，她周身散發著迷人的香氣，她的頭髮也很好聞，擁有她的感覺太神奇、太美妙了。

en: You had reached the top of the grief pyramid, your name was Jerry Alzheimer, and you were going to let Sandra put you into full-time care if that was her desire.
zh: 那一刻，你已經抵達未來，來到了憂傷的金字塔的頂端。你的名字是阿爾茨海默傑瑞，你打算讓桑德拉全職陪護你，如果這也是她的期望的話。

en: Sandra went inside to sit in the front row.
zh: 桑德拉走了進去，坐在前排。

en: There was already music playing in the church, but now it changed to a different piece that was your cue to start moving.
zh: 教堂里已經奏響音樂，但現在換了一首不同的曲目，這在暗示你行動開始了。

en: The flower girls, who were related to Rick in some way, wandered down the aisle first, everybody in the church going They’re so cute, they’re so cute, they’re so adorable, and they were adorable, of course they were, these little kids that didn’t have Alzheimer’s.
zh: 花童（她們都是瑞克的家人或親戚）首先走過甬道，教堂中在座的每一個人無不交口讚歎：「她們太可愛了，她們太可愛了，她們真可愛。」的確，她們非常可愛，這些女童沒有阿爾茨海默病。

en: The bridesmaids went next—two of them, friends of Eva’s since primary school —and then you led Eva, people in the crowd almost breaking their necks to get a better view, Eva beaming the whole way, little nods and extra smiles for certain people in the crowd, and you did what you had been told to do, nothing more, nothing less, step after step all the way to the front, and Jerry falls over and the crowd goes wild!
zh: 接下來出場的是伴娘，她們兩人從小學起就是伊娃的朋友。接著是你領著伊娃走了過來，人群中有人為了看得更清楚都差點兒伸斷了脖子。伊娃光彩照人，衝著人群中的某些人點頭、微笑。你順利完成了規定的動作，一步一步地向前走，恰到好處。

en: You sat next to Sandra and held her hand and the ceremony began.
zh: 你在桑德拉旁邊坐了下來，並握住她的手，儀式正式開始了。

en: You watched Eva get married.
zh: 你們見證伊娃的婚禮。

en: Rice was thrown at the end and people clapped as the happy couple walked back down the aisle, arms linked, lives linked.
zh: 人們向新郎和新娘身上拋撒稻米，幸福的新人又走回甬道，手臂相挽，心意相連，生命交織。人們在熱烈鼓掌。

en: Outside the photographer started putting the bridal party to work, Stand here, Smile, Now you, Now you and you, Now just the family.
zh: 外面，攝影師開始為新娘派對照相：「站在這裏，微笑。現在，現在，現在你們是家人了。」

en: If that was it, then it would have been a perfect day.
zh: 如果只有這些，那麼這將會是完美的一天了。

en: But of course Captain A had something else in mind, didn’t he?
zh: 但是，「阿爾茨船長」心中肯定會有別的想法，不是嗎？

en: The wedding party disappeared to other locations for more pictures, and everybody else had two hours to kill.
zh: 大家準備到別的地方去拍更多的照片了，中間將有兩個小時的空閑時間。

en: The crowd slowly departed, breaking up into mostly groups of two or three and getting into the cars to drive to the winery.
zh: 人們漸漸離去，三三兩兩地開車駛往酒庄。

en: Father Jacob stood outside shaking hands and making chitchat, and you had this weird image of him sticking business cards under all the windshield wipers, with little Ten percent off your next confession coupons attached, or Absolve two sins for the price of one.
zh: 雅各布神父站在門外一一與人握手攀談，你看見他在所有汽車的擋風玻璃上的雨刷下塞名片，覺得無比怪異，名片上印有「下次懺悔，九折優惠；免除罪孽，買一送一」的字樣。

en: Hans drove you to the winery, and Sandra went there with her parents.
zh: 漢斯開車送你到酒庄，桑德拉陪著她的父母親一道前往。

en: You sat at a table under a sun shade chatting with Hans as others slowly arrived, and it was like the church all over, everybody outside killing time and mingling, only the difference here was they were all holding glasses of wine or beer.
zh: 你和漢斯坐在遮陽傘下的一張桌子旁聊天，其他人陸續地來了，一切都和在教堂一樣，大家在外面閑談、消磨時間，唯一的不同是人們都端著杯葡萄酒或啤酒。

en: You were drinking water even though Hans had smuggled in two hip flasks full of gin and tonic for you, to which you told him thanks but no thanks, then thanks and had a drink anyway.
zh: 你在喝水，儘管漢斯偷偷給你帶來兩瓶加了奎寧水的杜松子酒，你對他說：「謝謝，不了，謝謝。」

en: The nerves were gone because there was nothing left to do except listen to the speeches, eat dinner, and maybe hit the dance floor.
zh: 喝了點酒，神經就不用綳得那麼緊了，剩下要做的只是聽聽致辭、吃吃飯，興許還能跳跳舞。

en: You only had the one drink, and were back to water when the speeches began, and you hated that you didn’t get to say anything, that Sandra was muzzling you for the occasion, and you thought . . .
zh: 你只喝了一杯酒，就又開始喝水了。這時致辭開始了，你恨自己，因為你想不起來說什麼；你也恨桑德拉，因為遇到這種情況她通常會叫你閉嘴。

en: this is what you thought: Hey, that’s my daughter too, everybody else gets to say something so why not me?
zh: 你在想……你是這樣想的：「那是我的女兒，別人都在講話，為什麼我不能講話？」

en: And the crowd went wild, didn’t they? The video online has now had 3,981 hits.
zh: 現在，網上視頻的點擊量為3981次了，傳播速度驚人。

en: And there you are, walking up to the stage.
zh: 看啊，你走上舞台。

en: Jerry Grey in his wedding suit and his funeral suit, but it’s not Jerry Grey at the wheel, it’s his magician buddy, Captain A.
zh: 傑瑞·格雷穿著婚禮服，穿著葬禮服，但此刻掌舵傑瑞·格雷身體的不是他自己，而是魔術師好友「阿爾茨船長」。

en: It’s all there for the world to see, 4,112 hits now, and the human race, well now, they sure do love a good show, don’t they?
zh: 現在，這裏發生的一切全世界都能看到了，點擊量已經到達4112次。人類啊，人類都希望看一出免費的好戲，不是嗎？

en: Let me describe it for you. Jerry Grey. At the stage and to his right the wedding table, and at the table are the wedding party, Rick and Prick and the groomsmen, Eva and her bridesmaids, glasses of wine and plates and flowers, and to Jerry’s left the band, and next to Jerry the emcee with the smile on his face, the kind of guy who was just going with the flow, the kind of guy who looked like he’d still be emceeing while the ship went down—and that is what happened, isn’t it?
zh: 讓我為你介紹吧，傑瑞·格雷站在舞台上，他的右邊是婚禮桌，桌旁坐著瑞克、普瑞克和伴郎以及伊娃和她的伴娘，桌上擺著幾杯葡萄酒、盤子和鮮花。

en: What’s he going to do?
zh: 他會說什麼？他會做什麼？

en: Well step on up, Future Jerry, and catch yourself a tale.
zh: 繼續吧，未來的傑瑞，我要講述自己的故事了。

en: My name is Jerry Grey, and for those of you who don’t know me, I’m the father of the bride, Jerry says, and he turns towards the wedding table and smiles at his daughter, and she’s smiling, or trying to, and off to the side people are standing near Jerry trying to figure out a way to get him to sit down.
zh: 我是傑瑞·格雷，可能有人不認識我，我是新娘的父親。」傑瑞說著轉向婚禮桌，朝他女兒微微一笑，她也笑了笑，站在一旁的人想讓傑瑞坐下，這是為了控制他，他們希望能有最好的收場。

en: As the father of the bride, I want to start out by thanking you all for coming along on what has been, and I’m sure my lovely wife will back me up here, one of the best days of our lives.
zh: 但傑瑞不希望被控制。「作為新娘的父親，首先我要感謝各位光臨小女的婚禮，而我敢肯定，我可愛的妻子會支持我。今天是我們生命中最美好的日子。

en: To see our little baby girl all grown up, to have become this beautiful, charming, and caring woman, well, I don’t need to tell you all what an honor and a pleasure it has been along the way as we’ve gotten to know her.
zh: 看到我們的小女兒長大成人，成長為美麗迷人、善良體貼的女人，她是我們今生的榮耀和希望。

en: And Rick, Jerry said, turning his attention to the groom, we are looking forward to getting to know you, and I want to welcome you to our family.
zh: 還有瑞克，」傑瑞說，他將視線轉向新郎，「我們期待了解你，歡迎你來到我們的家庭。」鼓掌。

en: Pause for clapping. But please, can you stop coming around to the house with that hip-hop music of yours cranked up?
zh: 「但是，拜託，到家裡來時能不能不要播放嘻哈音樂？

en: Now, some of you may know that I’m a crime writer, and that’s a very different beast from being a stand-up comic, which means I may not be able to make everybody laugh, but, Eva, what I can do if you ever need it is give you the perfect alibi.
zh: 「嗯，有些人可能知道，我是個犯罪小說家，和喜劇小說作家不同，我可能是一隻與眾不同的野獸，這意味著我不能讓每個人都開懷大笑，但是，伊娃，如果你需要的話，我也可以給你完美的不在場證明。」

en: More laughter this time.
zh: 這一次笑聲更加響亮。

en: Jerry is feeling good, feeling good, he’s looking comfortable on stage.
zh: 傑瑞感覺良好，感覺良好，他在舞台上看上去很愜意。

en: Why couldn’t you have sat down then, F.J.?
zh: 你為什麼不能坐下來呢？

en: As the father of the bride, having been where you’re sitting now twentyfive years ago, it reminds me of what my own dad said to me back then, a piece of advice I wish I had taken.
zh: 「作為新娘的父親，二十五年前我就坐在你們現在坐著的位置，這讓我想起我爸爸當時對我說的話。他給了我一些忠告，我真希望我當時聽從了。

en: He said, Jerry, run!
zh: 他說，傑瑞，快跑！」

en: Genuine laughter, especially from the older folks in the crowd who all can relate to what Jerry is saying.
zh: 特別是人群中的老人們，他們都能理解傑瑞說的意思。

en: But seriously, folks, as any parent will do when they’re seeing their child getting married, you think back to when it was your own time, you think back and you wonder how the years have gone by so quickly, there are always ups and downs in a relationship, and the older you are the more you’ve been through, and the more you’ve been through the more advice you can give.
zh: 「但說真的，朋友們，為人父母在看到自己的孩子結婚時都會這麼做，你會想起這個孩子只屬於你的時候。你會納悶，時間怎麼過得這麼快？一生中，總會有些潮起潮落，你年紀越大，經歷的事情越多，給孩子們的忠告就越多。

en: Of course everybody has advice, a lot of us say My advice is don’t take anybody’s advice, make your own way, and thankfully, folks, that’s not the chestnut of wisdom I’m here to impart.
zh: 當然，每個人都會有忠告，我們很多人會說：『我的忠告就是不要聽從他人的忠告，走自己的路，讓別人說去吧。』幸運的是，朋友們，這不是我要給你們的智慧箴言。

en: Rick, I’m hoping I can come to think of you like a son one day, and I want to tell you that you are a very, very lucky man marrying my daughter.
zh: 瑞克，希望我能把你當作兒子來看待，我想告訴你，娶了我的女兒你就是天底下最最幸運的男人。」

en: I envy you.
zh: 「我羡慕你。

en: You’re not making the mistake I made by marrying a whore.
zh: 你沒有犯我犯過的錯誤：我娶了一個婊子。」

en: There is a pause in the crowd as people try to interpret what Jerry just said.
zh: 人們都在想怎麼解讀傑瑞剛才說的話。

en: They heard the words—at least they think they did, because surely he didn’t just call his wife a whore, did he?
zh: 他們聽到了那些話，至少他們認為他們聽到了，因為他肯定不會稱他的妻子為婊子的，對吧？

en: And if he did, then surely it was a joke, wasn’t it?
zh: 要是他真這麼叫了，那肯定是個玩笑，對吧？

en: Jerry carries on. Had I mentioned that my lovely wife is a whore?
zh: 傑瑞繼續說：「我剛才是不是說我可愛的妻子是個婊子？」

en: Lots of gasping as people realize he’s not joking.
zh: 意識到他不是在開玩笑，許多人都倒吸了一口涼氣。

en: Everybody inhales at the same time and the air in the room goes thin, but Jerry hardly seems to notice.
zh: 在座的人們同時吸氣，酒莊裡的空氣都變得稀薄了，但傑瑞似乎沒有注意到。

en: He’s still looking at Rick and he’s smiling.
zh: 他還在微笑地看著瑞克。

en: I didn’t know it when I married her, but I do now, and isn’t
zh: 「我娶她時，我不知道。但我現在知道了，難道事情不總是這樣嗎？」

en: None. Jerry looks confused.
zh: 沒有人笑，傑瑞有點兒困惑了。

en: Hans has come up to the stage and is reaching for Jerry, but Jerry shrugs away from him.
zh: 「難道不是嗎？」漢斯走上舞台，伸手去拉傑瑞，傑瑞卻聳聳肩躲開了。

en: Sandra has been fucking people. Lots and lots of people, including my good friend Hans who’s right here, everybody, Jerry says, and points at his friend.
zh: 「桑德拉一直跟人亂搞，跟很多很多人，包括我的好朋友漢斯。

en: She’s a— And that’s as far Jerry gets, because then Hans is dragging him off stage, actually dragging him from the collar of his funeral suit, the back of Jerry’s feet sliding over the floor, and people are standing up, and somebody says in a high-pitched voice, holy shit, holy shit, holleee shit, and there’s Sandra, storming off, and Rick hugging his new wife, and Jerry still ranting away, bitch, slut, whore, all of it coming from his mouth.
zh: 傑瑞指著他的朋友說，「她想把我送進療養院，她好跟麵包師私奔。她是一個……」傑瑞說到這兒就停住了，因為漢斯已經在把他往舞台下拖，他拽著他禮服的衣領，傑瑞的腳在地板上滑動，人們都站了起來，有人高聲叫嚷著：「狗屁，胡說八道，胡說八道。」桑德拉猛地沖了過來，瑞克擁抱著他的新婚妻子，傑瑞仍然在咆哮，嘴裏不停地叫嚷著：「盪|婦！

en: Over six thousand hits now. It’s speeding up.
zh: 點擊量已達6000了，還在迅速增長。

en: Good news—at least the ceremony went okay.
zh: 好消息：至少儀式進行得還順利。

en: Bad news—it’s all bad news, partner.
zh: 壞消息：所有都是壞消息，老兄。

en: Hearing it coming over the radio is a confirmation Jerry doesn’t want.
zh: 收音機里的報道是傑瑞不想聽到的新聞。

en: He looks towards the police station. The top few floors are looming over the surrounding buildings.
zh: 他凝視著警局，在周圍的建築中，警局大廈的頂層若隱若現。

en: He can picture cops staring out the windows at him, binoculars finding him, a sniper rifle narrowing in on his head. He can picture a tactical team already in the elevators making their way to the ground floor.
zh: 他能想象得到警察正在透過窗戶舉著望遠鏡盯著他看，狙擊步槍正瞄準他的頭部，一個武裝警隊正乘電梯趕往一樓。

en: “They’re going to make the connection between the knife and the crime scene quickly,” Hans says.
zh: 「他們很快就會把刀和犯罪現場聯繫起來。」

en: “My guess is that evidence is already on its way back to the station and in about fifteen minutes they’re going to be fingerprinting everything and about fifteen minutes after that they’re going to have your name.
zh: 漢斯說，「我猜測證據已經在來警局的路上了，他們會在十五分鐘內進行指紋識別，十五分鐘后他們將知道你的名字。

en: You agree so far?”
zh: 你同意我的說法嗎？」

en: He nods. The crime writer inside of him agrees.
zh: 他點點頭，他犯罪小說家的內心已經同意了。

en: “Surveillance from the mall is going to find you going into the bathroom, and they’re going to run the footage in both directions and find out where you came from and where you went.
zh: 「他們會調看商場監控錄像，會發現你走進廁所，他們會查看兩個方向的畫面，弄清楚你從哪裡來，又去了哪裡。

en: It’s going to tell them that Jerry Grey committed a murder and had the sound mind to try and get away with it, which means when they come for you, they may be trigger-happy.
zh: 他們會知道傑瑞·格雷犯了謀殺罪，頭腦清晰，並且試圖逃脫法律的制裁，這意味著他們會來逮捕你，甚至很有可能會亂槍打死你。

en: If I take you in now, that can be avoided.”
zh: 如果我帶你去警局，就可以避免這一切。」

en: “You said before there was another option,” Jerry says. “I want to know what it is.”
zh: 傑瑞說：「你之前說還有另一條明路，我想知道那是什麼。」

en: “Whether you did this or not,” Hans says, “you look guilty. Nobody is going to see it any differently.
zh: 漢斯說：「無論你殺沒殺人，你都有重大的嫌疑，但沒有人會覺得那有什麼區別。

en: Even I don’t see it any differently.
zh: 即使是我，也沒有看到任何區別。

en: If they don’t shoot you when they find you, then there’ll be a trial, one that Eva will have to sit through and learn all the awful things you’ve done, and then they’re going to make a big show out of executing you, because that’s what they’re going to do, Jerry.”
zh: 如果他們抓到你，就算不打死你，也會對你進行審訊，伊娃會備受煎熬，去聽審訊，知曉你所做的那些可怕的事情，然後他們會公開處決你。後果不堪設想，傑瑞。」

en: “The death penalty, Jerry.
zh: 「處決？你他媽的在說什麼？」「死刑啊，傑瑞。

en: It got voted back in last year. There was a referendum.”
zh: 去年經過公投又恢復了，就在去年舉行了公投。」

en: “What?”
zh: 「什麼？」

en: “It was a big thing. The crime rate in this country, hell, you know it better than anybody.
zh: 「這是件大事，你比任何人都清楚這個國家的犯罪率。

en: The people wanted to be heard. It was a big talking point in what was an election year, and the result of that is it’s been voted back in, and the government agreed to do the will of the people. It hasn’t been enforced yet, but you trying to get away with this today, people are going to think you’re of sound mind and, therefore, you’re going to be a pretty good candidate for the noose.
zh: 人們希望有發表意見的權利，在大選年這就成了人們談論的焦點，結果就是人們投票要求恢復死刑，政府順從民意，不過還沒有強制執行過。

en: The country will finally get to see the results of their voting put into action.”
zh: 人們最終看到他們的投票結果付諸行動。」

en: “But I didn’t hurt anybody,” Jerry says.
zh: 「但我沒有傷害任何人。」傑瑞說。

en: “I love you like a brother, I really do, but that’s your future.
zh: 「我把你看作我的哥哥，我愛你，我真的愛你，但這就是你的命。

en: So the way I see it you have three options.”
zh: 所以，你有三種選擇。」

en: “We run,” Jerry says.
zh: 「我們跑。」傑瑞說。

en: “That’s not one of them,” Hans says.
zh: 「這個不算。」漢斯說，「你不能跑，我也不會讓你跑的。

en: “And three?”
zh: 「第三條呢？」

en: “Three is you go out on your own terms.
zh: 「第三條就是為你自己而死。

en: We go and find a sunset somewhere, we have a few drinks, we reminisce about old times, and we both drink a little too much and you take some pills and you—”
zh: 我們浪跡天涯，尋找夕陽，喝幾杯酒，懷念往昔，醉眼矇矓，然後你拿出一些藥片，你——」

en: “No.”
zh: 「不行。」

en: “You die with your dignity and with your best friend by your side.”
zh: 「你會帶著尊嚴死去的，最好的朋友就守候在你身邊。」

en: “Jesus, how can you—”
zh: 「天啊，你怎麼能——」

en: “Because you killed those girls, Jerry.
zh: 「因為你殺了那些女孩，傑瑞。

en: You killed Belinda Murray and Laura Hunt and the woman this morning, and you killed Sandra.
zh: 你殺了貝琳達·穆雷、勞拉·亨特和今天早上的那個女人，你還殺了桑德拉。

en: That’s how I can suggest it.
zh: 這就是我的建議。

en: And if you were thinking straight, you’d suggest the same damn thing.”
zh: 如果你還有理智，你會提出同樣的建議。」

en: “But I’m innocent.”
zh: 「但是我是無辜的。」

en: “Is that really what you think?” Hans asks.
zh: 漢斯問：「你真的這麼想？

en: “You think somebody set you up?
zh: 你覺得有人栽贓誣陷你？有人栽贓誣陷你嗎？」

en: “It’s possible,” Jerry says.
zh: 「有可能。」傑瑞說。

en: “Yeah? Is that Henry Cutter or Jerry Grey saying that?”
zh: 「是嗎？是亨利·卡特還是傑瑞·格雷說的？」

en: “Both.”
zh: 「兩個人都說了。」

en: “Look, Jerry, you could have taken a flight to Mars last week and you wouldn’t even know it.
zh: 「你看，傑瑞，上個星期你可以飛到火星的，你甚至不知道。

en: And if somebody set you up, how?
zh: 要是有人栽贓誣陷你，你能有什麼方法？

en: They give you Alzheimer’s too?”
zh: 是他們讓你患上阿爾茨海默病的嗎？」

en: “I didn’t do this,” Jerry says.
zh: 「我沒有殺人。」傑瑞說。

en: “I know you didn’t.
zh: 「我知道你沒有。

en: Jerry shakes his head. “This wasn’t the disease. It wasn’t me.
zh: 傑瑞搖了搖頭，說道：「不是這種疾病，不是我。

en: Somebody is doing this to me.”
zh: 是有人栽贓誣陷我。」

en: “Like in one of your books.”
zh: 「就像你書中所寫的。」

en: “Exactly!”
zh: 「沒錯！」

en: “You don’t think it’s more likely you snuck out of the nursing home and made your way to this woman’s house?”
zh: 「你不覺得更有可能是你偷偷溜出療養院，走到了這個女人的家裡？」

en: Hans asks.
zh: 漢斯問。

en: Jerry feels like screaming. He feels like punching a hole in the world. Why won’t his friend listen to him?
zh: 傑瑞感覺自己想嘶吼，想在地球上戳個大洞，為什麼他的朋友不聽他的？

en: “Please, you have to trust me.”
zh: 「拜託，你要相信我。」

en: “Trust you?
zh: 「相信你？

en: Tell me about Suzan with a z,” Hans says.
zh: 你跟我說說蘇姍。」漢斯說。

en: Jerry doesn’t answer him.
zh: 傑瑞沒有回答他。

en: “Tell me about her.”
zh: 「跟我說說她。」

en: “She was different,” Jerry says.
zh: 「她不一樣。」傑瑞說。

en: “Different how?”
zh: 「怎麼不一樣？」

en: “Because her I remember killing.
zh: 「因為我能記得殺死了她。

en: I’m sorry, and I wish—”
zh: 我很抱歉，我希望——」

en: Hans puts up his hand to stop him. “She’s different, Jerry, because she doesn’t exist. She never existed.”
zh: 漢斯揮手制止了他：「她不一樣，傑瑞，那是因為她根本就不存在，她根本就不存在。」

en: Jerry doesn’t answer him, not right away, but then the brain chemistry does that little trick it sometimes does, it washes over and clears another memory, and he wonders at what expense, at what other fact or person he’s just forgotten.
zh: 傑瑞沒有回答他，至少沒有馬上回答，但隨後大腦化學物質又開始起了一些小化學反應，它沖洗並清除另一段記憶，他想知道這個代價是什麼，他到底還忘記了哪些事、什麼人。

en: “She’s from the books, isn’t she.”
zh: 「她是書中的人物，對嗎？」

en: “Yes.
zh: 「是的。

en: So don’t you think it’s possible that if you can remember killing a woman who never existed that you may not be able to remember killing one who does?”
zh: 難道你不認為要是你能記得殺死了一個根本不存在的女人，那麼你可能會記不得殺死一個現實存在過的女人？」

en: It makes sense. Perfect sense.
zh: 這說得通，完全合理。

en: “We need to find the journal,” Jerry says.
zh: 「我們需要找到那本日記。」傑瑞說。

en: “What journal?”
zh: 「什麼日記？」

en: “The one I couldn’t find yesterday.”
zh: 「我昨天去找了，但沒有找到。」

en: “What are you talking about?”
zh: 「你在說什麼？」

en: “You don’t know?” Jerry asks.
zh: 「你不知道嗎？」傑瑞問。

en: “Know what?” Hans asks.
zh: 「知道什麼？」漢斯問。

en: “About my Madness Journal?”
zh: 「我的『狂人日記』。」

en: “What in the hell are you talking about, Jerry?”
zh: 「你到底在說什麼，傑瑞？」

en: “I’ve been keeping a journal since the day I was diagnosed with Alzheimer’s.
zh: 「自從我被診斷出患有阿爾茨海默病，我一直在寫日記。

en: I was calling it a Madness Journal. I thought you knew.”
zh: 我稱它為『狂人日記』，我還以為你知道呢。」

en: Jerry can see his friend’s mind racing.
zh: 傑瑞可以看到他的朋友的腦子裡的齒輪在飛轉。

en: “What was in it?”
zh: 「裏面寫的什麼？」

en: Hans asks.
zh: 漢斯問。

en: “Everything,” Jerry says.
zh: 「所有的事情。」傑瑞說，「所有我當時能記得而現在不記得的事情。

en: “Everything I could remember back then that I can’t remember now. I wasn’t writing in it every day, but I wrote in it plenty.
zh: 不是每天都寫，但我寫了很多。

en: It was a way of reminding my future self of who I was.
zh: 這可以提醒未來的我，過去的我曾是個什麼樣的人。

en: That future self is me, I guess, but without it I can’t remember what I wrote.”
zh: 我想，未來的我當然是我，但沒有它，我連寫過什麼都不知道了。」

en: “Did you write in it when Sandra died?”
zh: 「桑德拉死的時候你還在寫？」

en: “I don’t know, but I imagine I would have.”
zh: 「我不知道，但我想我會。」

en: “How do you know the police didn’t find it?”
zh: 「你怎麼知道警方沒有發現呢？」

en: Jerry shakes his head.
zh: 傑瑞搖了搖頭。

en: “They didn’t.
zh: 「他們沒有。

en: Nobody knows where it is,” Jerry says.
zh: 沒有人知道它在哪裡。」

en: “There’s a hiding place in my house—”
zh: 傑瑞說，「我的房子里有個密室——」

en: “It’s no longer your house, Jerry.”
zh: 「那不再是你的房子了，傑瑞。」

en: “I know that, Christ, I know that, okay?”
zh: 「我知道，老天，我知道，行了吧？」

en: Jerry says, throwing his hands into the air. “I remember thinking last night I needed to find the journal, and that I had to find a way to escape so I could go and find it.”
zh: 傑瑞說著，雙手舉過頭頂，「我記得昨天晚上我在想，我需要找到那本日記，所以我必須找到逃出療養院的方法，這樣我就可以去找它了。」

en: Hans runs both his hands over the top of his head. “Ah, geez, Jerry . . . really?”
zh: 漢斯用雙手搓著頭頂：「啊，天啊，傑瑞，是真的嗎？」

en: “That journal might prove I’m innocent.”
zh: 「日記可能會證明我是無辜的。」

en: “Or it might prove the opposite.”
zh: 「或者，也可能得到相反的證明。」

en: “Then at least I’d know, right?
zh: 「那麼，至少我會知道的，對不對？

en: But there’s a problem.”
zh: 但是，有一個問題。」

en: “Because there’s a new owner,” Hans says.
zh: 「因為那座房子有了新主人。」漢斯說。

en: “We went there yesterday—”
zh: 「我們昨天去了那裡——」

en: “We?”
zh: 「我們？」

en: “Me and Nurse Hamilton. Gary let us—” “Gary?”
zh: 「我和漢密爾頓護士，加里讓我們——」「加里？」

en: “The new owner.
zh: 「就是新主人。

en: He let us inside and I found the hiding spot, but there was nothing there, only I think it was there and Gary found it and is hiding it, the journal and the gun.”
zh: 他讓我們進入房子，我發現了暗格，但那裡什麼也沒有。然而，我認為它就在那裡，只是加里發現了並藏了起來，包括日記和槍。」

en: Hans frowns. “The gun?”
zh: 漢斯皺皺眉，說：「槍？」

en: “The police never found that either, but maybe it’s not there because I didn’t shoot Sandra?”
zh: 他說，因為漢斯老是打斷他的話感到很沮喪，「警察也沒有發現，但也許根本就不在那裡，因為我沒有打死桑德拉，不是嗎？」

en: “Is that also what your nurse thought?
zh: 「你的護士也是這樣想的嗎？

en: That the new owner was hiding the journal?”
zh: 新主人把日記藏了起來？」

en: “I don’t know,” Jerry says. “I remember thinking they were all in on it.”
zh: 傑瑞說：「我不知道，但我記得當時他們都在。」

en: “All?”
zh: 「所有人？」

en: The way Hans asks that, it makes Jerry realize how crazy he’s sounding.
zh: 漢斯的問話方式使傑瑞意識到自己瘋到什麼地步了。

en: They’re all in on it.
zh: 「他們都在。」

en: That’s also right from the Henry Cutter playbook.
zh: 這句話同樣也出自亨利·卡特的一個劇本。

en: “There was an orderly there too. They had to sedate me.
zh: 「還有一個護理員，他們得讓我鎮靜下來。

en: But the journal has to be there, right?
zh: 不過，日記應該還在那裡，對不對？

en: “Jesus, will you just let me finish?”
zh: 「他們得讓你鎮靜下來？」「天哪，你可不可以讓我把話說完？」

en: “There are too many blanks, Jerry.”
zh: 「我不知道的太多了，傑瑞。」

en: “They had to sedate me because the shirt made them think the worst, and they wouldn’t believe me about the journal, and the journal is the key to all of this.
zh: 「他們必須讓我保持鎮靜，因為我的襯衫讓他們想到了最糟糕的情景，他們不會相信我說的那些日記，而日記卻是解決所有事情的關鍵。

en: That’s why—”
zh: 這就是為什麼——」

en: “What shirt?”
zh: 「什麼襯衫？」

en: “There was a shirt under the floor,” Jerry says, wishing his friend could keep up.
zh: 「地板下面有一件襯衫。」傑瑞說，希望他的朋友能聽明白。

en: “Was it blue?
zh: 「是不是藍色的？

en: Was it covered in blood?”
zh: 上面滿是血跡？」

en: “Yes.”
zh: 「是的。」

en: “That’s the shirt you wore to the wedding.
zh: 「那是你穿去參加婚禮的襯衫。

en: You were wearing it that night when I picked you up.”
zh: 那天晚上我去接你時，你就是穿著那件襯衫。」

en: “Don’t you see?” Jerry asks.
zh: 「你難道不明白嗎？」傑瑞問。

en: For the first time he feels like he’s on track.
zh: 他第一次覺得他離題了。

en: “We have to go back there and convince Gary to give the journal to us. That has to be why I left the nursing home.
zh: 「我們必須接著剛才的話往下說，我們需要說服加里把日記給我們，日記是我離開療養院的原因，

en: That must be where I was trying to go.
zh: 那兒一定是我想要去的地方。

en: If I can find the journal and prove I didn’t do any of this, then Eva will want to be in my life again.
zh: 如果我能找到那本日記，證明我沒有殺人，那麼伊娃就會回到我的生活中來。

en: She’ll call me Dad.
zh: 她會來看我的，她會叫我『爸爸』。

en: You have no idea how it feels to have a child who wants nothing to do with you.”
zh: 你知不知道自己的孩子想和你脫離關係是種什麼感覺？」

en: “You’re sure it exists, this journal of yours.”
zh: 「你確定它存在嗎，一本記錄你這段時間的思想和行為的日記？」「確定。」

en: “Absolutely.”
zh: 「好吧。」

en: “Okay,” Hans says. “So let’s say it does.
zh: 漢斯說，「那麼，咱們就先認定它存在吧。

en: What’s your plan?
zh: 你的計劃是什麼？

en: We go and make Gary tell us where it is?
zh: 咱們先去找加里，讓他說出它在哪裡？

en: Either somebody else found it, or you hid it elsewhere.
zh: 要麼是別人發現了，要麼是你藏在了別處。

en: Where else could you have hidden it?”
zh: 你還有可能把它藏在哪裡？」

en: “I don’t know.
zh: 「我不知道。

en: What I do know is that I need your help.
zh: 我所知道的是，我需要你的幫助。

en: Please. Will you help me?”
zh: 拜託，幫幫我，好嗎？」

en: Hans says nothing for a while. He just stares at Jerry, and Jerry can see Hans’s mind unlocking the problem, the way he always has.
zh: 一時間，漢斯陷入了沉默，只是盯著傑瑞，傑瑞可以看到漢斯的大腦正在層層撥開這個謎團，他總有辦法的。

en: “Okay,” Hans says. “Let’s head back to my house and work on a plan.”
zh: 漢斯說：「好吧，咱們先到我家去，制訂一個計劃。」

en: “Why don’t we go straight to my old house?”
zh: 「我們為什麼不直接去我原來的家？」

en: “Because we have to think about it, Jerry.
zh: 「因為我們要思考思考，傑瑞。

en: It’s foolish to rush into something without a plan.”
zh: 沒有計劃，莽撞行事是愚蠢的。」

en: “But—”
“Trust me. Going in without one is a surefire way of failure.
zh: 「相信我，不制訂計劃難以做到萬無一失。
